parameters.name: PModDoc
parameters.description: Model document in which to create the loft body

parameters.name: Profile
parameters.description: Array of sketches representing the profiles of the loft body

parameters.name: GuideCurve
parameters.description: Array of sketches representing the guide curves of the loft body

parameters.name: Centerline
parameters.description: Sketch representing a centerline of the loft body

parameters.name: IsThinBody
parameters.description: True if the loft body is to be a thin body, false if not

parameters.name: ThinType
parameters.description: 0 = One direction 1 = One direction reverse 2 = Midplane 3 = Two direction

parameters.name: Thickness1
parameters.description: Value for thickness for first direction if a thin body

parameters.name: Thickness2
parameters.description: Value for thickness for second direction if a thin body

parameters.name: FeatureScope
parameters.description: True if the loft body only affects selected bodies, false if the loft body affects all bodies

parameters.name: IsBlendClosed
parameters.description: True for a closed loft, false for an open loft; if true and you selected less that three profiles, then any selected guide curves must be closed curves

parameters.name: KeepTangency
parameters.description: If the section curves are tangent, then you have the option to specify whether the resulting faces are also tangent; specify true to maintain the tangency as seen in the section curves, false to not NOTE: When generating tangent surfaces, SOLIDWORKS maintains planar and cylindrical surface shapes if the section curves exhibit these characteristics.

parameters.name: ForceNonRational
parameters.description: True to force the resulting surface to be non-rational, false to not

parameters.name: IsSolidBody
parameters.description: True to return a solid loft body, false to return a surface loft body

parameters.name: TessTolFactor
parameters.description: Factor to control the number of intermediate sections used for loft with centerline; default value is 1.0; the greater the variable, the more intermediate sections created

parameters.name: StartTangentLength
parameters.description: Start tangent length

parameters.name: EndTangentLength
parameters.description: End tangent length

parameters.name: StartTangentDir
parameters.description: True is one direction, false is the opposite direction

parameters.name: EndTangentDir
parameters.description: True is one direction, false is the opposite direction

parameters.name: StartMatchingType
parameters.description: Tangency type at the start profile: 0 = none 1 = tangent to the normal of the profile 2 = tangent to the selected vector 3 = tangent to all adjacent faces sharing an edge with the start profile

parameters.name: EndMatchingType
parameters.description: Tangency type as the end profile : 0 = none 1 = tangent to the normal of the profile 2 = tangent to the selected vector 3 = tangent to all adjacent faces sharing an edge with the start profile

parameters.name: Merge
parameters.description: True merges the results in a multibody part, false does not

title: IModeler.CreateLoftBody2
description: Creates a loft body using the specified profiles, guide curves, and centerline.
signature:

parameters.name: PModDoc
parameters.description: Model document in which to create the loft body

parameters.name: Profile
parameters.description: Array of sketches representing the profiles of the loft body

parameters.name: GuideCurve
parameters.description: Array of sketches representing the guide curves of the loft body

parameters.name: Centerline
parameters.description: Sketch representing a centerline of the loft body

parameters.name: IsThinBody
parameters.description: True if the loft body is to be a thin body, false if not

parameters.name: ThinType
parameters.description: 0 = One direction 1 = One direction reverse 2 = Midplane 3 = Two direction

parameters.name: Thickness1
parameters.description: Value for thickness for first direction if a thin body

parameters.name: Thickness2
parameters.description: Value for thickness for second direction if a thin body

parameters.name: FeatureScope
parameters.description: True if the loft body only affects selected bodies, false if the loft body affects all bodies

parameters.name: IsBlendClosed
parameters.description: True for a closed loft, false for an open loft; if true and you selected less that three profiles, then any selected guide curves must be closed curves

parameters.name: KeepTangency
parameters.description: If the section curves are tangent, then you have the option to specify whether the resulting faces are also tangent; specify true to maintain the tangency as seen in the section curves, false to not NOTE: When generating tangent surfaces, SOLIDWORKS maintains planar and cylindrical surface shapes if the section curves exhibit these characteristics.

parameters.name: ForceNonRational
parameters.description: True to force the resulting surface to be non-rational, false to not

parameters.name: IsSolidBody
parameters.description: True to return a solid loft body, false to return a surface loft body

parameters.name: TessTolFactor
parameters.description: Factor to control the number of intermediate sections used for loft with centerline; default value is 1.0; the greater the variable, the more intermediate sections created

parameters.name: StartTangentLength
parameters.description: Start tangent length

parameters.name: EndTangentLength
parameters.description: End tangent length

parameters.name: StartTangentDir
parameters.description: True is one direction, false is the opposite direction

parameters.name: EndTangentDir
parameters.description: True is one direction, false is the opposite direction

parameters.name: StartMatchingType
parameters.description: Tangency type at the start profile: 0 = none 1 = tangent to the normal of the profile 2 = tangent to the selected vector 3 = tangent to all adjacent faces sharing an edge with the start profile

parameters.name: EndMatchingType
parameters.description: Tangency type as the end profile : 0 = none 1 = tangent to the normal of the profile 2 = tangent to the selected vector 3 = tangent to all adjacent faces sharing an edge with the start profile

parameters.name: Merge
parameters.description: True merges the results in a multibody part, false does not

remarks:
Specifying guide curves and a centerline are optional. It is best to use guide curves, especially when you select profiles in the FeatureManager design tree.
You must specify the profiles in an order consistent with the desired direction of the loft. If creating a solid loft body, then the profiles must be closed. You can use any number of profiles. However, if you specify only one profile, then any specified guide curves must be closed curves.
Linear edge, sketch line, axis, plane and planar faces are qualified for tangency vector sections.

examples.title: Create Loft Surface Body and Change Into Feature (VBA)
